description: The first commercial video game, Pong, was released by Atari.
Pac-Man was released by Namco, becoming one of the most famous arcade games.
The video game industry crash occurred, impacting North America heavily.
Nintendo released the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in North America.
Nintendo released the Game Boy, revolutionizing portable gaming.
Sonic the Hedgehog was released by Sega, becoming a major rival to Mario.
Sony launched the first PlayStation console, entering the gaming market.
Nintendo released the Nintendo 64, introducing 3D gaming to consoles.
The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time was released, setting a benchmark for 3D adventure games.
Sony released the PlayStation 2, which would become the best-selling console of all time.
Microsoft entered the gaming industry with the launch of the Xbox and Halo: Combat Evolved.
World of Warcraft was released, becoming the most successful MMORPG.
Nintendo released the Wii, introducing motion-based gaming.
Valve released The Orange Box, which included Portal, Team Fortress 2, and Half-Life 2: Episode Two.
Minecraft was released in its alpha version, becoming one of the best-selling games ever.
Sony released the PlayStation 4, ushering in the eighth generation of consoles.
Pok√©mon GO was released, popularizing augmented reality gaming.
Nintendo released the Nintendo Switch, blending handheld and console gaming.
Cyberpunk 2077 was released, drawing attention for its troubled launch despite years of anticipation.
The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom was released, becoming a critically acclaimed sequel to Breath of the Wild.
